III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation When youth was previously placed at the facility, he was sexually
assaulted by a staff member. Another youth was also sexually
assaulted by the same staff member.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on November
20, 2023. He reported Youth A was talking about the different
placements he has lived in foster care and reported that his
favorite staff was Staff 1. When Complaint Source asked Youth A
why that was, he reported that was because Staff 1 allowed him
2

and some of his peers to “crack her open.” Complaint Source
reported Youth A was telling peers how he was able to “get with”
Staff 1 in a sexual manner. Youth A reported Staff 1 no longer
works at the facility. Complaint Source reported he did not ask any
more questions.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at his current CCI
facility on November 20, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS
Worker 2 and on November 28, 2023. Youth A reported he lived
at Wolverine Center between February 2023 and April 2023.
Youth A reported Staff 1 was a third-shift staff and was able to
connect with the youth at the facility because she could relate to
their life circumstances. Youth A reported he knew why he was
being interviewed today and at first, was very reluctant to talk. He
reported he was not raped, and no one did anything crazy. Youth
A reported Staff 1 only had sex with him once. He reported Staff 1
was attractive, and it mistakenly happened. He reported one night
he went AWOL, he returned to the facility high and drunk. After
Youth A returned to the facility, he went into his room, and Staff 1
conducted a safety check on Youth A in his room. He reported
Staff 1 then started to talk to him and they were “trauma bonding,”
because Staff 1 was having a bad day. Youth A reported he was
upset because it was the anniversary of something in his life and
did not want to discuss further what that was. He reported one
thing led to another, and Youth A had sex with Staff 1 in his room.
Youth A was asked who initiated the sexual acts, he reported he
did not initiate it and did not want to go into detail about it. When
asked to explain what happened, he reported “his dick was inside
her, every place it could go.” Youth A reported it was a mistake
and it only happened once. He denied knowledge of Staff 1 having
sex with other youth at the facility and she only had sex with him.
Youth A reported this happened almost a year ago and did not
want anything to come from it. When asked to explain what Staff 1
looked like, Youth A stated he does not remember and refused to
answer any questions as it pertained to the looks of Staff 1. He
reported he has not talked to Staff 1 since he left the facility. Youth
A reported that he did not want to talk about the situation anymore
and wanted to leave.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on January 16, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 1 reported she used
to be the third shift supervisor at the facility. She reported in her
role she would help support staff in a crisis or when a youth would
return from AWOL. Staff 1 reported she never would open up a
male youth’s bedroom without another male staff present. She
reported she never did room checks as that was a task for her
3

staff to complete. Staff 1 reported staff would do room checks by
shining a flashlight into the room to see the youth and reported if
they could not see the youth, they would open the door. She
reported a staff never went into a youth’s room without another
staff present. Staff 1 reported she has never been alone with
Youth A and denied ever having a sexual relationship with him.
She stated she never crossed any boundaries with the youth and
noted that she never disclosed her personal life. Staff 1 reported
she does believe she told the youth once, “Life can be hard some
days but need to show up, I showed up after the father of my
children passed away.” She reported she just wanted to
encourage the youth to do better, and life is worth living. Staff 1
reported she never had sexual encounters with anyone at the
facility. She reported she pressed charges against Youth B due to
him sexually assaulting her by touching her inappropriately.
Youth B was interviewed face to face on December 6, 2023,
by MDDHS Worker 3 and on phone by this consultant. Youth B
reported he was placed at the facility during the time Youth A was
placed there and they were friends. He reported there were no
concerns with sexual behaviors from staff at the facility. Youth B
reported he had never seen Staff 1 be inappropriate with the
youth. He reported he never heard from Youth A of Staff 1 having
an inappropriate relationship with Youth A. Youth B reported he
did face sexual harassment charges from Staff 1 but did not want
to talk about it. He reported he was never touched inappropriately
by Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on December 4, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 2 reported she is a
third-shift worker at the facility. She reported she does not
remember Youth A, but his name does sound familiar. Staff 2
reported she worked with Staff 1 on the third shift and stated that
she was a supervisor. She reported she has never had a concern
with Staff 1’s relationship with the youth. She reported Staff 1 was
a motherly figure to the youth and never heard her disclose her
personal life with the youth, she would just show compassion to
the youth like they were her own children. Staff 2 reported she
never heard of any concerns from the youth about Staff 1’s
behaviors. She reported in the over 20 years she has worked at
the facility she has never heard any reports from a youth about
having an inappropriate relationship or sexual activity with a staff
member. Staff 2 reported within her role she is to perform room
checks and they are to shine a flashlight into a youth’s room if she
cannot see them. She reported she is to never go into a bedroom
alone and that it should be two staff members. Staff 2 reported if a
4

youth is struggling with emotions staff can sit in the doorway of the
youth’s room to talk to them but never inside. She reported she
has never seen Staff 1 go into a youth’s room alone. When asked
about the return from AWOL policy at night, Staff 2 reported all
youth need to go to the hospital to get checked out when they
return from an AWOL, they do not just come right back into the
facility. She reported this policy has been in place for over a year
now.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on December 5, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 3 reported he worked
at the facility when Staff 1 was working at the facility and is
currently no longer employed at the facility. He reported he
worked the third shift with Staff 1 when she was the supervisor of
the night shift. Staff 3 reported he never heard of Staff 1 having a
sexual relationship with any of the youth, including Youth A. He
reported Staff 1 was a nice staff to the youth, was stern and made
sure the youth’s needs were always met on the third shift. Staff 3
reported he had never seen Staff 1 go into a youth’s room for a
long period of time. Staff 3 reported he did not really see Youth A
because he was always AWOL or going to the hospital. He
explained during the time Youth A was placed in that facility the
protocol was if a youth was AWOL for more than an hour, they
would have to go to the hospital to get medically cleared. He
reported if a youth was AWOL for less than an hour they could go
back to their room unless there was a medical concern.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on December 5, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 4 reported she
worked the third shift with Staff 1 when Youth A was placed there.
She reported she never heard of any concerns about Staff 1
having a sexual relationship with a youth. Staff 4 reported Youth A
had negative behaviors at times at the facility where he destroyed
property and went AWOL. She stated Staff 1 would never have a
sexual relationship with a youth and Youth A is known for lying.
Staff 4 reported Staff 1 did press charges on Youth B for touching
her butt and reported that the youth was close with Youth A. She
reported she never saw Staff 1 go into any of the youth’s
bedrooms alone. She stated that two staff always go into a youth’s
room and only if it is needed. Staff 4 reported the AWOL process if
a youth returns from AWOL, they need to get medically cleared at
the hospital and two staff would transport the youth to the hospital.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on December 7, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 5 reported she
worked with Staff 1 and Staff 1 was the night shift supervisor. She
5

reported the night shift is scheduled to work from 11pm to 7am.
Staff 5 reported the procedure is to continue supervision during
third shift and she stated that the policy is to stand outside of a
youth’s room when needing to complete a check. She stated a
staff member is to never go into a room alone and there is
typically always two staff members when doing room checks. Staff
5 reported she never observed Staff 1 going into a youth’s room
and never heard concerns of Staff 1 having inappropriate
boundaries with youth. She reported Staff 1 did not even talk
about her personal life with staff let alone disclose it to youth. Staff
5 reported she was working when Youth A was placed there and
there was never any reports of sexual assaults involving Youth A
or Staff 1 with each other or any other person.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 22, 2023, in collaboration with MDDHS Worker
1. Supervisor reported he had worked with Staff 1 before her
termination and noted that he had never seen her have poor
boundaries with youth. He reported Staff 1 was a more strict staff
and never heard her talk about her personal life with the youth.
Supervisor reported Staff 1 was not very friendly with the youth
and was actually terminated due to her frustrations with the youth
at the facility. Supervisor reported he also worked at the facility
when Youth A was placed there, and Youth A never reported any
concerns.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 22, 2023, in collaboration with MDDHS Worker
1. Therapist reported she was working at the facility when Youth A
was placed there and there were never any reports of sexual
concerns with Youth A. She reported Youth A had behavioral
problems and would AWOL from the facility multiple times.
Therapist reported there were no records noting Staff 1 having
inappropriate boundaries with the youth. She reported Staff 1
worked third shifts at the facility from December 2022 until July
2023. Therapist reported Staff 1 was terminated due to an
investigation that found Staff 1 had physically assaulted a youth.
Therapist reported she has never received concerns from the
youth about Staff 1 being too friendly with the youth and stated
that the youth complained more about Staff 1 being too strict.
Documents Reviewed:
-Email with Foster Care Worker dated 11/20/2023- Foster Care
Worker has been Youth A’s foster care worker since before he
was placed at the facility. Foster Care Worker reported Youth A
never disclosed to her about Staff 1 or any sexual acts occurring
6

at the facility. She reported she did not have any concerns with
the facility in general.
- Youth A’s File from facility- Youth A was placed at the facility
from 02/13/2023-04/10/2023. The following incident reports were
reviewed within Youth A’s file; On 03/02/2023, Youth A went
AWOL from the facility at 8:48pm and returned to the facility on
9:25pm. On 03/03/2023, Youth A went AWOL from the facility at
5:35pm and returned a couple hours later, no concerns noted. On
03/04/2023, Youth A was arrested for property destruction. On
03/13/2023, Youth A went AWOL from the facility at 5:00pm and
returned at 8:15 pm and there were no concerns noted. On
03/18/2023, Youth A went AWOL from the facility at 4:00pm and
returned a couple hours later and there were no concerns noted.
On 03/21/2023, Youth A went AWOL from the facility at 3:30pm
and returned at 6:00pm. On 03/22/2023, Youth A went AWOL
from the facility at 4:00pm and returned back at 4:30pm. On
03/26/2023, Youth A went AWOL from the facility at 11:00 am and
returned back at 2:30pm. On 04/05/2023, Youth A went AWOL
from the facility at 7:15pm and returned back to the facility at
8:35pm. From all the incident reports, Youth A was never noted to
have the concerns of being under the influence of substances.
Staff 1 was not involved in any of these incident reports and Youth
A never returned from AWOL when Staff 1 was scheduled to start
work.
-Email from Chief Administrator dated 12/07/2023- Chief
Administrator reported in her email, the facility does not have a
written policy related to taking a youth to the hospital upon return
from AWOL. Staff are to assess each youth on an individual basis.
If there are concerns related to a youth appearance, concerning
behaviors, appears to be under the influence of any substance or
there is a history of substance use, the youth is taken for medical
clearance to the hospital. Chief Administrator reported the facility
does not have a written policy, but it is best practice for two staff
members going into a youth’s room when necessary. If there is an
emergency, staff will go into a youth’s room without a second staff
member present.
- Youth B MiSACWIS incident report dated 04/02/2023- Staff 1
was taking Youth B to use the restroom and while walking in front
of Staff 1, Youth B turned around and pulled out his penis. On that
same day, Youth B had touched Staff 1 on her butt during the
walk to the gym area. Staff 1 informed all proper parties on both
incidents and a police report was filed.
7

- Facility Employee Handbook- Within the Employee Standards
of Conduct it states, “Staff may not enter into any type of romantic
or sexual relationship with clients, including clients who have been
released from the facility.” The employee handbook also states,
“Staff must not socialize on a personal level with present or former
client of facilities; Staff must not have any sexual or inmate
contact with present or former residents of facilities.”
-Staff 1’s Human Resource File- On 2/24/23, Staff 1 was
provided a warning due to not completing the appropriate
documentation when an incident occurred on 2/18/23. On
07/01/2023, Staff 1 was terminated due to the findings of special
investigation 2023C0000590. Staff 1 had completed all required
trainings including a Grooming Behaviors training on 03/07/2023.
-Special Investigation Report 2023C0000590- Findings included
Staff 1 pouring shampoo on a youth after a youth poured
shampoo on her and Staff 1 physically assaulting a youth after the
youth had physically assaulted Staff 1. It is noted Staff 1 was
terminated from the facility after these findings were made.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there is no evidence to find
Staff 1 had an inappropriate sexual contact with Youth A or any
other youth at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
